CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 17, 1950, pg. 10, reads: "Lovely June Brides - Among the early June brides are Mrs. Richard Thomas, left, and Mrs. James E. Armstrong, right...Mrs. Armstrong is the former Rebecca N. West, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John R. West. - Teenie Harris Photo." Article reads: "Rebecca West Weds at Parents' Home - Many friends and relatives witnessed the beautiful wedding ceremony uniting Miss Rebecca N. West, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John R. West, and James E. Armstrong, recently.  The rites were repeated in home of the bride with the Rev. C. E. McFadden officiating.  Miss Helen West attended her sister as maid of honor.  Russell Hancock served the groom as best man.  The bride was resplendent in a gown of floral designed organdy accentuated by a finger-tip illusion veil.  A reception followed the wedding by many out-of-town guests including Mrs. Nannie West, the bride's grandmother; Mrs. Emma Baptist and Mrs. Eva Carson the bride's aunts, and Richard Tyler, all of New York City."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of wedding party with two men, including groom James E. Armstrong and possibly best man Russell Hancock, and two women, including bride Rebecca N. "Becky" West Armstrong, wearing v-neck dress with floral embroidery on skirt, and possibly maid of honor Helen West posed in West home in front of oval portrait of woman on wall, and wooden mantle with two vases of gladiolus, 7600 Mulford Street, Homewood
